subject: RE: [junit] [OT] Eclipse plugin
msgSnippet: But that also means that the file has to be open in the editor.  I want to avoid that. Someone responded to me privately with this link:
messageBody:
But that also means that the file has to be open in the editor. I want
to avoid that.

Someone responded to me privately with this link:
http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/os-ecjdt/?ca=dnt-429. I
gave a first stab at it with some of the tips in the article but didn't
quite have it right. When I get it right I will post it somewhere.

=jason

On Wed, 2003-07-30 at 04:14, Shaun Smith wrote:
> I've been looking into this myself to write a similar plugin.
> In 2.1.1, you can just go ALT+R,A,3 to run the current class as a Junit
> test.
